title: Nigeria’s World Cup dream alive as DR Congo face player eligibility probe
summary: FIFA is reviewing complaints that could affect DR Congo’s 2026 World Cup qualifier win, keeping Nigeria’s qualification hopes open while the case is examined.

title: Nigeria secures largest-ever military aircraft acquisition in West Africa with 24 M-346FA jets
summary: The Nigerian Air Force confirmed an order for two dozen M-346FA light attack jets from Italy, citing the fleet boost as its biggest fixed-wing purchase to date in the region.

title: Nigerian pension system evolving to meet realities of diaspora workforce
summary: PENCOM officials told BusinessDay that ongoing reforms are designed to let Nigerians working abroad plug into the contributory pension scheme more easily and securely.

title: Swansea designated cultural hub for African diaspora
summary: Voice of Nigeria reports the Welsh city has been formally recognised for African diaspora programming, spotlighting Nigerian-led arts partnerships across the UK.

title: NIDCOM registers over 100,000 Nigerians abroad
summary: The Nigerians in Diaspora Commission says its voluntary registration portal has logged six-figure sign-ups, helping map skilled nationals across continents for investment and policy outreach.

title: Nigeria’s global view: Call for responsible patriotism, diplomatic prudence
summary: The Guardian’s editorial urges Nigerians at home and abroad to balance activism with careful diplomacy as the country navigates regional security and economic headwinds.
